speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE III. An ante-chamber in the palace.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain and SANDS

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Is't possible the spells of France should juggle

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Men into such strange mysteries?

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: New customs,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Though they be never so ridiculous,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Nay, let 'em be unmanly, yet are follow'd.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: As far as I see, all the good our English

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Have got by the late voyage is but merely

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: A fit or two o' the face; but they are shrewd ones;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: For when they hold 'em, you would swear directly

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Their very noses had been counsellors

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To Pepin or Clotharius, they keep state so.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: They have all new legs, and lame ones: one would take it,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: That never saw 'em pace before, the spavin

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Or springhalt reign'd among 'em.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Death! my lord,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Their clothes are after such a pagan cut too,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: That, sure, they've worn out Christendom.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Enter LOVELL

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: How now!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What news, Sir Thomas Lovell?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Faith, my lord,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I hear of none, but the new proclamation

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: That's clapp'd upon the court-gate.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What is't for?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: The reformation of our travell'd gallants,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: That fill the court with quarrels, talk, and tailors.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I'm glad 'tis there: now I would pray our monsieurs

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To think an English courtier may be wise,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And never see the Louvre.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: They must either,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: For so run the conditions, leave those remnants

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Of fool and feather that they got in France,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: With all their honourable point of ignorance

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Pertaining thereunto, as fights and fireworks,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Abusing better men than they can be,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Out of a foreign wisdom, renouncing clean

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: The faith they have in tennis, and tall stockings,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Short blister'd breeches, and those types of travel,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: And understand again like honest men;

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Or pack to their old playfellows: there, I take it,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: They may, 'cum privilegio,' wear away

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: The lag end of their lewdness and be laugh'd at.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: 'Tis time to give 'em physic, their diseases

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Are grown so catching.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What a loss our ladies

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Will have of these trim vanities!

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Ay, marry,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: There will be woe indeed, lords: the sly whoresons

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Have got a speeding trick to lay down ladies;

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: A French song and a fiddle has no fellow.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: The devil fiddle 'em! I am glad they are going,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: For, sure, there's no converting of 'em: now

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: An honest country lord, as I am, beaten

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: A long time out of play, may bring his plainsong

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: And have an hour of hearing; and, by'r lady,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Held current music too.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Well said, Lord Sands;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Your colt's tooth is not cast yet.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: No, my lord;

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Nor shall not, while I have a stump.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Sir Thomas,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Whither were you a-going?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: To the cardinal's:

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Your lordship is a guest too.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: O, 'tis true:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: This night he makes a supper, and a great one,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To many lords and ladies; there will be

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The beauty of this kingdom, I'll assure you.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: That churchman bears a bounteous mind indeed,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: A hand as fruitful as the land that feeds us;

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: His dews fall every where.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: No doubt he's noble;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: He had a black mouth that said other of him.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: He may, my lord; has wherewithal: in him

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Sparing would show a worse sin than ill doctrine:

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Men of his way should be most liberal;

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: They are set here for examples.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: True, they are so:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: But few now give so great ones. My barge stays;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Your lordship shall along. Come, good Sir Thomas,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: We shall be late else; which I would not be,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: For I was spoke to, with Sir Henry Guildford

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: This night to be comptrollers.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: I am your lordship's.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Exeunt
